name: Vitamin - Modeller GUI
tagline: GUI for Modeller, a protein modeling software
body:
ViTaMIn - Visual Table Modeller Interface Version 1.0 12/08/2014
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY;
for details, visit http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html

GENERAL USAGE NOTES
--------------------

- This software combines several tools for protein modeling, such as BLAST 
search for templates, Modeller, procheck and PyMOL. All the process, from 
searching templates to model evaluation and refining can be done in the ViTaMIn.

- You WILL need a valid Modeller license (free for academics, 
https://salilab.org/modeller/registration.html). ViTaMIn installer will not 
install Modeller, but you can find Installation Notes for it on official website
.

- You can use the software, redistribute and make any changes in the code, as 
long as you keep original credits. For redistribuition, please consider giving 
the official link (in which you may have download this file, I hope =D). This 
way I can keep record of the number of downloads and see if my software is 
working as I planned (don't worry, no confidential records neither user ID is
recorded, it is a download counter only). 

- Please consider feedback. This is the only way to track bugs and make improves
.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Installing ViTaMIn under Linux
_______________________________

Dependecies
------------
ViTaMIn depends on the following packages:

- Modeller (9.9 or newer)
- pymol (0.99 or newer, 1.3+ recommended)
- procheck 
- matplotlib (1.2 or newer)
- biopython (1.6 or newer)
- GTK3+
- python (2.7.x) 



System Requirements
--------------------
The major job is done by Modeller, and as is, it needs a i686 or amd64 processor
to work. The faster your processor, the faster your job is done. There is no 
minimum requirements. Internet connection is required for BLAST search engine 
only, but you can use it without one if you have sequences and pdbs on your disk
.




Ubuntu 12.04 or newer 
----------------------
Installing ViTaMIn in Ubuntu is a straight process using the provided script 
(install). The script checks and install dependencies automatically (may require
root permission) and set procheck on your machine. Note that the procheck 
version is the most update to date provided by Roman Laskowski, with a simple 
change in the gets function (to fgets) in order to use newer versions of the cc
compiler. You can choose not to install procheck, if you already have a working
version with the 'procheck' alias.

For Installion, use the command in download folder:
Easy way:
open terminal (install git if you don't have it already)
git clone http://github.com/gustalima/vitamin-stable
cd vitamin-stable
./install

Without git:
Download Vitamin.tar.gz and procheck.tar.gz and install 
run the install file with the following command
./install



Other distros
--------------
For all other distros, you will need to get dependencies by yourself. It's not
that hard, and most distros have them in their repositories. Once your system
dependencies are OK, untar the tarball file provided in any folder and run from 
terminal. Any missing dependencies you may have will be alerted in your terminal
.
